markdown: **PROCEDURE NOTE** Procedure Note No.: 98-04R4 Date: December 21, 2000 Temporary: Effective Date: 12/21/2000 Termination Date: option Permanent: [x] RJR Domestic: JTI: Common: Type: Product option Tobacco: [x] Material: Process: Packaging: Other: Flavor: PRO Alert: option Yes: [x] option No: [ ] SUBJECT: G14-9A and G19-33A Materials Handling Update to Specifications **OBJECTIVE:** Amend Short term Material Handling guidelines for G14-9A **BACKGROUND:** G14-9A is produced at CRES Tobacco and its current usage, after blending with G19 at Tobaccoville Diet Operations, is in *Turkish Gold* and *Camel Special Lights* products. The storage policy for G14-9A has from the outset been: * Immediate Cold Storage of G14-9A after production at CRES Tobacco (per PN-96-18R2). * Excess G14-9A should be shipped back to Cold Storage as soon as possible after G19-33A blending at TV. Testing was conducted in August 2000 to assess the impact of short term storage (≤ 30 days) at plant Temperature/RH for G14-9A stored in cans. Data from this testing (TPD 752) is attached. The test results indicate that product NH3 content is nominally unchanged after 30 days in plant versus current product (stored initially at Cold Storage and called out as required). Allowing G14-9A to be canned out at CRES Tobacco (vs. boxing) and stored/used in ≤30 days at Tobaccoville Diet Operations would provide five (5) benefits: * Neither operation is currently staffed for Boxing/un-boxing operations. At the current requirements level this is managed through employee re-assignment. At higher volume levels, additional staffing could be required. * Eliminates current cost for boxes (one time use). * Eliminates handling cost charge from cold storage. * Reduces trucking cost. * Fresher product will be used in normal production. To facilitate G14-9A usage in ≤ 30 days, CRES Tobacco will produce G14-9A in smaller lot sizes, approximately every other week, as ordered by Production Planning. There will be no additional line cleaning costs at CRES Tobacco versus current nor impact on product quality parameters as a result of this proposal. 98-04R4 robinson w.doc 1 12/15/00 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/fllg0224 52385 1187

chunks.markdown: Procedure Note No.: 98-04R4 Date: December 21, 2000 Temporary: Effective Date: 12/21/2000 Termination Date: option Permanent: [x] RJR Domestic: JTI: Common: Type: Product option Tobacco: [x] Material: Process: Packaging: Other: Flavor: PRO Alert: option Yes: [x] option No: [ ] SUBJECT: G14-9A and G19-33A Materials Handling Update to Specifications

**OBJECTIVE:** Amend Short term Material Handling guidelines for G14-9A **BACKGROUND:** G14-9A is produced at CRES Tobacco and its current usage, after blending with G19 at Tobaccoville Diet Operations, is in *Turkish Gold* and *Camel Special Lights* products. The storage policy for G14-9A has from the outset been: * Immediate Cold Storage of G14-9A after production at CRES Tobacco (per PN-96-18R2). * Excess G14-9A should be shipped back to Cold Storage as soon as possible after G19-33A blending at TV.
Testing was conducted in August 2000 to assess the impact of short term storage (≤ 30 days) at plant Temperature/RH for G14-9A stored in cans. Data from this testing (TPD 752) is attached.
The test results indicate that product NH3 content is nominally unchanged after 30 days in plant versus current product (stored initially at Cold Storage and called out as required).

Allowing G14-9A to be canned out at CRES Tobacco (vs. boxing) and stored/used in ≤30 days at Tobaccoville Diet Operations would provide five (5) benefits: * Neither operation is currently staffed for Boxing/un-boxing operations. At the current requirements level this is managed through employee re-assignment. At higher volume levels, additional staffing could be required. * Eliminates current cost for boxes (one time use). * Eliminates handling cost charge from cold storage. * Reduces trucking cost. * Fresher product will be used in normal production.

To facilitate G14-9A usage in ≤ 30 days, CRES Tobacco will produce G14-9A in smaller lot sizes, approximately every other week, as ordered by Production Planning. There will be no additional line cleaning costs at CRES Tobacco versus current nor impact on product quality parameters as a result of this proposal.
